Package com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets

Class ImageView

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget
      • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control
        • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Scrollable
          • org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite
            • com.eclipsesource.tabris.widgets.ImageView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, org.eclipse.rap.rwt.Adaptable, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SerializableCompatibility
    public class ImageView
extends org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite

    A widget to display an image.

    The ImageView is a stand alone Widget. It needs to be part of your layout.

    Since:
    3.4
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setImage

        public void setImage​(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Image image)
        Sets the receiver's image to the argument, which must not be null.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the image is null or has been disposed
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • setScale

        public void setScale​(float scale)
        Sets image scale factor. The default is 1.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the scale factor is zero or negative
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -

      • setScaleMode

        public void setScaleMode​(ImageView.ScaleMode scaleMode)
        Selects the method used for image scaling. The default is ScaleMode.AUTO.
        Parameters:
        scaleMode - the scale mode to use, must not be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -

      • setTintColor

        public void setTintColor​(org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color tintColor)

      • setZoomEnabled

        public void setZoomEnabled​(boolean zoomEnabled)

        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -

      • getZoomEnabled

        public boolean getZoomEnabled()
        Returns true if image zoom is enabled, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if image zoom is enabled
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • setZoomLevel

        public void setZoomLevel​(float zoomLevel)
        Sets the amount that the image is zoomed in or out. The default position without any zooming has the value 1.0.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the zoomLevel is invalid
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • getZoomLevel

        public float getZoomLevel()
        Returns image zoom level.
        Returns:
        the image zoom level
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • setMinZoomLevel

        public void setMinZoomLevel​(float minZoomLevel)
        Sets the lowest amount the image can be zoomed out to. Setting the minZoomLevel to a level larger than the current zoomLevel changes the zoomLevel to be the same as the new minZoomLevel.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the minZoomLevel is invalid
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • getMinZoomLevel

        public float getMinZoomLevel()
        Returns image minimum zoom level.
        Returns:
        the image minimum zoom level
        Throws:
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver

      • setMaxZoomLevel

        public void setMaxZoomLevel​(float maxZoomLevel)
        Sets the highest amount the image can be zoomed out to. Setting the maxZoomLevel to a level smaller than the current zoomLevel changes the zoomLevel to be the same as the new maxZoomLevel.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • ERROR_INVALID_ARGUMENT - if the maxZoomLevel is invalid
        org.eclipse.swt.SWTException -
        • ERROR_WIDGET_DISPOSED - if the receiver has been disposed
        • ERROR_THREAD_INVALID_ACCESS - if not called from the thread that created the receiver
